entry.title: How a Popular Medical Device Encodes Racial Bias
entry.quote: Pulse oximeters give biased results for people with darker skin. The consequences could be serious.

entry.title: Developers, Choose Wisely: a Guide for Responsible Use of Machine Learning APIs
entry.quote: I wondered whether the positive sentiment of the phrase “Fair & Lovely” might trick the emotion analysis tool and lead to the misclassification of a sentence’s sentiment, even if the overall sentiment of the sentence may not be positive.

entry.title: Taming the Tail: Adventures in Improving AI Economics
entry.quote: As the CTO of one late-stage data startup put it, AI development often feels “closer to molecule discovery in pharma” than software engineering. This is because AI development is a process of experimenting, much like chemistry or physics. The job of an AI developer is to fit a statistical model to a dataset, test how well the model performs on new data, and repeat. This is essentially an attempt to reign in the complexity of the real world.

entry.title: When Data Renders Invisible Illnesses Visible
entry.quote: How ‘small’ data visualization helps complex patients be heard, seen, and believed

entry.title: What a Doctor Learns From Watching You on Video Chat
entry.quote: Patients and doctors are rediscovering the unexpected virtues and hidden pitfalls of homebound care.
